Hi,

I am in the process of writing Junit tests for MBeans.
I have read some comments made in a different mailing
list about the approach to be using for unit testing
MBeans. 
one of the approaches suggested was to treat MBeans as
normal Javabeans and you go about testing the methods
as you would test any other java bean.

The question I have regarding this approach is:

MBeans in Jboss have a field called State which Jboss
sets to started using the ServiceCOntroller MBean. If
methods in the MBean are dependent on this field. Is
there any way to actually set the field without
actualy integrating it with the container? or would
testing this method constitue a "Junit Integration"
test?

Regards,
Ravi
